Package edu.rpi.legup.ui

Class ProofEditorPanel

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
edu.rpi.legup.ui.LegupPanel
edu.rpi.legup.ui.ProofEditorPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
IHistoryListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, Accessible
public class ProofEditorPanel extends LegupPanel implements IHistoryListener
ProofEditorPanel is a panel that serves as the main user interface component for the proof editing functionality of LEGUP. It provides the graphical components and interactive elements necessary for editing and managing proofs, including toolbars, menus, and views for different aspects of proof editing. It also manages interactions with the rest of the application and updates the UI based on user actions and application state changes.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • ProofEditorPanel

      public ProofEditorPanel(FileDialog fileDialog, JFrame frame, LegupUI legupUI)

      Parameters:
      fileDialog - the FileDialog used for file operations
      frame - the JFrame that contains this panel
      legupUI - the LegupUI instance managing the user interface

  • Method Details

    • makeVisible

      public void makeVisible()
      Makes the panel visible by setting up the toolbar and content components. This method also sets the menu bar of the frame to the one used by this panel.
      Specified by:
      makeVisible in class LegupPanel

    • getMenuBar

      public JMenuBar getMenuBar()
      Constructs and returns the JMenuBar for this panel. It populates it with various JMenu and JMenuItem components related to file operations, editing, viewing, and proof management. The menu bar includes:
      • File menu with options to open a new puzzle, reset the puzzle, save the proof, access preferences, and exit the editor.
      • Edit menu with options for undo, redo, and fitting the board or tree to the screen.
      • Proof menu with options for adding, deleting, merging, collapsing elements, and toggling settings related to rule applications and feedback.
      • About menu with options to view information about the application and access help resources.

      Accelerator keys are set based on the operating system (Mac or non-Mac).

      Returns:
      the JMenuBar instance containing the menus and menu items for this panel

    • exitEditor

      public void exitEditor()
      Clears the current puzzle, resets the UI to display the initial panel, and nullifies the references to the tree panel and board view.

    • promptPuzzle

      public Object[] promptPuzzle()
      Opens a file chooser dialog allowing the user to select a directory. It uses the user's preferred directory or the last saved path if available. The selected directory is used to set the new working directory.
      Returns:
      an array containing the file name and the selected file, or null if the operation was canceled

    • loadPuzzle

      public void loadPuzzle()
      Calls promptPuzzle() to get the file information and then loads the puzzle using the provided file name and file object. Updates the frame title to reflect the puzzle name. If the file is not valid or an error occurs, an error message is shown, and the user is prompted to try loading another puzzle.

    • loadPuzzle

      public void loadPuzzle(String fileName, File puzzleFile)
      Attempts to load a puzzle from the given file. If successful, it updates the UI to display the puzzle and changes the frame title to include the puzzle name. If the file is invalid or cannot be read, it shows an appropriate error message and prompts the user to try loading another puzzle.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the name of the file to load
      puzzleFile - the file object representing the puzzle file

    • add_drop

      public void add_drop()

    • noquit

      public boolean noquit(String instr)
      Displays a confirmation dialog with a specified message. Returns true if the user selects "No" or cancels the action, and false if the user selects "Yes".
      Parameters:
      instr - the message to display in the confirmation dialog
      Returns:
      true if the user chooses not to quit, false otherwise

    • setupContent

      protected void setupContent()
      Configures the layout and components for the main user interface. This includes setting up panels, split panes, and borders, and adding them to the main content pane.

    • setToolBar1Buttons

    • setPuzzleView

      public void setPuzzleView(Puzzle puzzle)
      Initializes the dynamic board view, updates the tree panel, and sets rules and search panels based on the provided puzzle. It also updates toolbars and reloads the GUI.
      Parameters:
      puzzle - the puzzle to be displayed

    • reloadGui

      public void reloadGui()
      Calls repaintTree() to refresh the tree view.

    • repaintTree

      public void repaintTree()
      Updates the tree view displayed in the tree panel to reflect the current state of the tree.

      Specified by:
      onPushChange in interface IHistoryListener
      Parameters:
      command - action to push onto the stack

    • onClearHistory

      public void onClearHistory()
      Updates the state of the undo and redo buttons to reflect that there are no actions available to undo or redo. It disables both buttons when the history is cleared.
      Specified by:
      onClearHistory in interface IHistoryListener

    • onRedo

      public void onRedo(boolean isBottom, boolean isTop)
      Called when an action is redone
      Specified by:
      onRedo in interface IHistoryListener
      Parameters:
      isBottom - true if there are no more actions to undo, false otherwise
      isTop - true if there are no more changes to redo, false otherwise

      Specified by:
